act.name: Setup
act.description: This is the beginning of the story where the main characters, setting, and initial conflict are introduced. Establish the foundation of the story and engage the audience's interest. It typically includes the "inciting incident," which is the event that sets the main plot in motion and disrupts the protagonist's normal life.

sequence.name: Introducing Protagonist's Daily Life
sequence.description: Showcase the protagonist's routine, relationships, and environment.

sequence.name: Establishing World's Rules and Tone
sequence.description: Introduce the rules of the story's world and setting the tone for the narrative.

sequence.name: Present the Disruptive Event
sequence.description: Introduce the event that disrupts the protagonist's normal life and sets the story in motion.

sequence.name: Initial Reaction of the Protagonist
sequence.description: Portray the protagonist's initial response and emotions upon encountering the inciting incident.

act.name: Confrontation
act.description: Also known as the "rising action," This is where the protagonist faces challenges, obstacles, and conflicts that escalate as the story progresses. The tension and stakes increase, leading to a pivotal moment known as the "climax." The climax is the highest point of tension in the story and involves the protagonist confronting the main obstacle or antagonist.

sequence.name: Reluctance or Resistance
sequence.description: Depict the protagonist's initial reluctance or resistance to engage with the new situation.

sequence.name: Introduction of Challenges
sequence.description: Introduce challenges that push the protagonist to confront the central conflict.

sequence.name: Raising the Stakes
sequence.description: Increase tension by introducing additional obstacles or antagonistic forces.

sequence.name: Building Tension
sequence.description: Gradually build tension and anticipation leading up to the story's climax.

sequence.name: Direct Confrontation
sequence.description: Depict the protagonist's head-on confrontation with the main obstacle, resulting in a turning point.

act.name: Resolution
act.description: This is the final act where the story's conflicts are resolved. After the climax, there's a period of falling action where loose ends are tied up and the story's outcomes are determined. This act provides closure to the audience and showcases the characters' growth and transformation based on their experiences throughout the story.

sequence.name: Aftermath of the Climax
sequence.description: Address the aftermath of the climax and explore the consequences of key decisions.

sequence.name: Resolution of Subplots
sequence.description: Resolve any remaining subplots or loose ends in the story.

sequence.name: Character Growth and Transformation
sequence.description: Showcase the protagonist's growth, transformation, or change in perspective.

sequence.name: Main Conflict Resolution
sequence.description: Resolve the main conflict and demonstrate how the characters have evolved.

sequence.name: Final Character Arcs
sequence.description: Wrap up any final character arcs or lingering plot points.

sequence.name: Sense of Closure
sequence.description: Provide a sense of closure leaving the audience with a lasting impression.
